title: How to Repair Cracked & Broken Blush

steps.title: Break the blush with a spoon.
steps.content: Break the blush with a spoon. Using the back of a metal spoon, delicately grind the broken blush into powder form. Crushing the blush into as fine of a powder as possible will make it significantly easier to reform and flatten later on. [1] X Research source You’ll want to use a metal spoon instead of a plastic one, as you’ll eventually be using the spoon to flatten the blush back into place. You may find a plastic spoon to be much less sturdy and more difficult to manage in the flattening process. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Add in a few droplets of rubbing alcohol.
steps.content: Add in a few droplets of rubbing alcohol. [3] X Expert Source Ivy Boyd Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 4 August 2021 Add at least 4-5 drops of rubbing alcohol into the container of blush. You want to make the blush powder moist enough to stick together and form a paste, so add more as needed. If you are repairing a smaller amount of blush, you may want to use less rubbing alcohol. [4] X Research source For easier application, you can use a spray bottle to add rubbing alcohol to the blush powder. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Mix the alcohol thoroughly with a spoon.
steps.content: Mix the alcohol thoroughly with a spoon. Use the metal spoon to combine the rubbing alcohol and the blush powder. Continue to mix until the blush looks like paste instead of powder. [6] X Research source If your blush container is on the smaller side, consider using a toothpick to stir in the rubbing alcohol. [7] X Research source

steps.title: Flatten the blush with the spoon.
steps.content: Flatten the blush with the spoon. [8] X Expert Source Ivy Boyd Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 4 August 2021 Using the back of a metal spoon, press the blush paste mixture into the container until it appears flat. Once you have completed the process, leave the blush container exposed to open air overnight so that it can dry. [9] X Research source Depending on the size of the container, a tissue can be spread over the blush paste and a coin can be used to flatten the paste mixture. [10] X Research source To finish the process, press the blush with a paper towel to absorb the remaining alcohol and set the new flatten shape. [11] X Expert Source Ivy Boyd Makeup Artist Expert Interview. 4 August 2021

steps.title: Crush the blush into pieces with a toothpick.
steps.content: Crush the blush into pieces with a toothpick. Using a wooden toothpick, break the broken pieces of blush into a finer powder. This process can be long or short depending on how broken your powdered blush is initially. [12] X Research source Consider using a larger instrument (i.e, pencil) if you want to break up the blush more quickly. [13] X Research source

steps.title: Even out the blush powder with a knife.
steps.content: Even out the blush powder with a knife. Use a small, dull knife to mark vertical and horizontal lines down the container of blush powder. This will ensure that the blush is equally distributed throughout the makeup pan. [14] X Research source To prevent any accidental injury, try to avoid using any sharp knives.

steps.title: Lay a makeup removing wipe on the blush.
steps.content: Lay a makeup removing wipe on the blush. Take a generic makeup removal wipe and place it on top of the blush powder. This moist wipe will help the powder become more compact in the container. [15] X Research source Make sure that your blush container is lying flat on a surface before you continue to place a wipe. [16] X Research source

steps.title: Use your fingertips to help combine the blush pieces.
steps.content: Use your fingertips to help combine the blush pieces. Once the makeup wipe is in place, use your fingertips to push the blush powder down into the container beneath the makeup wipe. Continue to apply pressure so that the powder can be as flat as possible. This will allow the loose powder to combine and reform at the bottom of the makeup pan. [17] X Research source

steps.title: Dab the blush powder with a makeup removing wipe.
steps.content: Dab the blush powder with a makeup removing wipe. After you have firmly pressed the blush into a flat position, use a crumpled makeup wipe to apply a final bit of pressure to the powder. This will help to secure the blush powder into its container. [18] X Research source Gently tilt your blush container if you want to double check for any loose powder. [19] X Research source
